Interaction: The potential effects from airborne noise from support vessel activity.
Specific Management Measures: Adherence to Scotish Marine Wildlife Watching Code (SMWWC).
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to removal or alteration of energy flow arising from devices and moorings or support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Design structures to minimise effect on turbulence structure.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to removal or alteration of energy flow arising from devices and moorings or support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Modelling to predict the interaction between changes in tidal flow, flux, and turbulence structure and animals.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for disturbance from project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Reduce speed and maintain steady course when animal is sighted.
Implications of Measure: Reduces potential effects and is a relatively low cost measure.

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Avoid the introduction of hard bottom substrate into a soft bottom habitat.
Implications of Measure:
Ensures the efficient recovery of species native to the surrounding habitat. 
May have technical implications.

Interaction: Potential barrier to movement due to the physical presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures, cables and electrical equipment.
Specific Management Measures: Adherence to vessel management plan.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in device mooring lines and cables.
Specific Management Measures: Minimise the number of mooring lines.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from subsea cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Bundle cables together to reduce field vectors.
Implications of Measure:
Reduce the level of EMF to surrounding water column and therefore any potential effects.

Could result in there being less redundancy in the system and potential commercial and technical feasibility issues.

Interaction: The introduction of infrastructure and artificial substrates will provide potential roosting habitat.
Specific Management Measures: Monitor use of device as a roosting platform.
Implications of Measure: Reduces scientific uncertainty around collision risk, displacement and other impacts, however this type of monitoring can be expensive.

Interaction: Potential for oil/hydraulic spill incident resulting from the maintenance activities.
Specific Management Measures: All maintenance activities involving oil/hydraulic fluid treatments will be carried out on-shore.
Implications of Measure: Reduces the chance for oil spill to the environment

Interaction: Potential displacement of essential activities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Site selection (taking into account cumulative impact of other developments).
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Install propeller guards.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Modifications to prey distribution and abundance (to include for other receptors) resulting in changes to foraging behaviour.
Specific Management Measures: Modelling to predict the interaction between changes in tidal flow, flux, and turbulence structure and animals.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for disturbance from project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Use smaller vessels for maintenance purposes.
Implications of Measure: Reduces potential effects and is a relatively low cost measure.

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Monitoring and reporting of MNNS.
Implications of Measure: Reduce/removes risk of transfer of non-native species.

Interaction: Reduced visibility impacting prey detection and obstruction avoidance.
Specific Management Measures: Best practice methodologies to reduce resuspension of sediment during cable burial or device foundation/mooring installation.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in device mooring lines and cables.
Specific Management Measures: Install strain gauges on the device
Implications of Measure: It allows alerting the operator of an entanglement event

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from subsea cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Bury or HDD cables where possible and viable.
Implications of Measure:
Reduces the level of EMF to surrounding water column and therefore any potential effects. 

Reduces 'snagging risk' for vessels.

Potential for adverse impacts on surrounding benthic habitats and sensitive species, e.g. from smothering.

This measure forms part of normal project design.

Interaction: The introduction of infrastructure and artificial substrates may generate additional habitat diversity.
Specific Management Measures: Structure colonization and biofouling surveys.
Implications of Measure: Informs understanding of potential for increased prey availability and ecological diversity which could benefit future project applications, however there is a cost implication associated with monitoring.

Interaction: Potential displacement of essential activities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Timing of installation and decommissioning & marine operations to avoid times of particular sensitivity (e.g. breeding).
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Install a 'detect and deter' system using a combination of active sonar and acoustic deterrent device (ADD).
Implications of Measure:
This could reduce likelihood of collision with moving blades although the efficacy of ADDs in these environments is unknown and habituation to ADDs is known to occur in other industries. Could enable a route through the consenting process.

This measure is expensive to implement and it is still unknown if deterrent systems will help reduce risk. There are also questions around the effects of ADDs on sensitive species. Their addition adds another noise impact which must also be considered in any project assessments. Would rely on well proven and reliable 'detect and deter' systems. Also, mitigation against collision may prevent discovering whether or not it is a real issue.

Further research around ADDs which deter specific groups or species, is underway. This could be useful  in deterring  specific sensitive species or species groups, at a particular site. For example, University of St Andrews is seveloping an ADD which deter seals, but which don't effect cetaceans.

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to removal or alteration of energy flow arising from devices and moorings or support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Site selection.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential barrier to movement due to the physical presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures, cables and electrical equipment.
Specific Management Measures: Site selection to avoid sensitive routes/areas.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Antifouling application on components such as the pile and rotor blades.
Implications of Measure: To prevent colonisation of the device and prevent the structure forming a stepping stone for non-native species.

Interaction: Sediment disturbance disrupting water clarity that results in smothering of fish spawning grounds.
Specific Management Measures: Best practice methodologies to reduce resuspension of sediment during cable burial or device foundation / mooring installation.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential risk of entrapment within device chambers and mooring arrays.
Specific Management Measures: Release entrapped animal.
Implications of Measure: Animal may be deceased before it is able to be released.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from subsea cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Micrositing of offshore infrastructure to avoid sensitive habitats and minimise footprint.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce/remove effects on sensitive habitats and is a relatively low cost measure.

Interaction: Direct loss of protected or sensitive intertidal communities from changes in hydrodynamics due to nearshore WECs.
Specific Management Measures: Micrositing of nearshore WECs  to minimise the impact on sensitive habitats and species.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential displacement of essential activities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Timing of installation and decommissioning & marine operations to avoid times of particular sensitivity (e.g., breeding).
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential displacement of essential activities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Array/mooring configuration designed to avoid migratory routes or other important sites
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Install acoustic deterrent devices (ADDs).
Implications of Measure: This could potentially reduce likelihood of collision with moving blades although the efficacy of ADDs in these environments is unknown. Constant deterring means habituation is likely. This is a simpler system than detect (efficiently) and deter, however would still be expensive to implement. It would also come with an additional noise impact which must also be considered in project assessments.

Interaction: Potential for accidental or unplanned events which could lead to contamination of the marine environment.
Specific Management Measures: Physical Containment systems including bulk heads, closed circuit systems, pressure relief systems.
Implications of Measure: Reduces risk of contamination escaping from structure.

Interaction: Modifications to prey distribution and abundance (to include for other receptors) resulting in changes to foraging behavior.
Specific Management Measures: Site selection.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential barrier to movement due to the physical presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures, cables and electrical equipment.
Specific Management Measures: Array/mooring configuration designed to avoid migratory routes or other important sites
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: The potential effects from airborne noise generated during installation/construction (excluding piling).
Specific Management Measures: Avoid/limit 'noisy works' within close proximity to sensitive sites (e.g., known seal haul outs and important cliff nesting sites) during sensitive periods, defining appropriate clearance distances where necessary.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce potential effects on sensitive species during sensitive periods, but could increase project construction timescales and thus costs e.g. if continuous drilling time is restricted or specific periods need to be avoided.

Interaction: Reduced visibility impacting prey detection and obstruction avoidance.
Specific Management Measures: Minimize the amount of structure on the seabed.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential risk of entrapment within device chambers and mooring arrays.
Specific Management Measures: Regular ROV/drop down camera surveys to establish occurrence of entrapment
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from landfall cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Install cable protection/armour.
Implications of Measure: Higher levels of insulation reduces the level of EMF to surrounding water column and therefore any potential effects.

Interaction: Loss of intertidal habitat from trenching for cable landfall.
Specific Management Measures: Pre-construction cable route surveys to avoid sensitive habitats.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential displacement of essential activities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Array/mooring configuration designed to avoid migratory routes or other important sites.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in device mooring lines and cables.
Specific Management Measures: Maintain taut mooring lines.
Implications of Measure:
Would remove/reduce risk of entanglement, however mooring design driven by technical and commercial consideration.

Entanglement records are a useful way to track events.

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Environmental monitoring to detect collision events.
Implications of Measure: Understand avoidance behaviour, nature of interactions and  outcome of collision events, however effective monitoring is expensive and requires a lot of data analysis.

Interaction: Potential for accidental or unplanned events which could lead to contamination of the marine environment.
Specific Management Measures: Material selection - lubricants, coolants, hydraulic fluids etc., - selected with low ecotoxicity levels and biodegradable.
Implications of Measure: Reduces/removes risk of contamination from materials which may have escaped structure. Although, use of lower toxicity materials may compromise performance, or impact other technical issues (e.g. fluid changes).

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Environmental monitoring to detect collision events.
Implications of Measure: Helps to develop an understanding of avoidance behaviour, nature of interactions and  outcome of collision events. However, there are cost implications assocaited with this level of monitoring.

Interaction: Sediment disturbance disrupting water clarity that results in smothering of fish spawning grounds.
Specific Management Measures: Minimize the amount of structure on the seabed.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: The introduction of infrastructure and artificial substrates will provide habitat and artificial refuges.
Specific Management Measures: Monitor near-field behaviours.
Implications of Measure: Informs understanding of potential positive impacts from colonisation and use of the project infrastructure which could benefit future project applications, however there is a cost implication associated with monitoring.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from landfall cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Limit cable voltage.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Direct loss of protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed communities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings or support structures on the seabed.
Specific Management Measures: Micrositing of offshore infrastructure to avoid sensitive habitats and minimise footprint.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce/remove effects on sensitive habitats and can often be done with little additional costs.

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to removal or alteration of energy flow arising from devices and moorings or support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Benthic and intertidal surveys focused on indicator species, species assemblage, community structure and ecosystem function.
Implications of Measure: Would result in a reduction of scientific uncertainty around the interaction, however determining impacts against natural variability may be difficult.

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in device mooring lines and cables.
Specific Management Measures: Fishing debris detected during routine inspections of mooring lines and cables will be removed.
Implications of Measure: Would remove/reduce risk of entanglement and is a low cost measure, implemented as part of standard O&M procedures.

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Implement a 'soft start'/cut in speed management approach during cut-in at sensitive sites, i.e. those where the potential for collisions is high.
Implications of Measure:
Soft start - this could reduce risk by allowing marine mammals time to move away from the turbine and could be done at a relatively low cost.

Cut in speed management - this could be used to reduce risk during periods of known higher activity in sensitive sites. 

It is still unclear whether these offer additional mitigation and to an extent a soft start happens naturally. Implementation of this measure could result in a loss of revenue for the developer.

Interaction: Potential for accidental or unplanned events which could lead to contamination of the marine environment.
Specific Management Measures: Where rock placement is used, ensure clean rock is used.
Implications of Measure: Reduces/removes risk of contamination from materials.

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Implement a 'soft start'/cut in speed management approach at sensitive sites, i.e. those where the potential for collisions is high.
Implications of Measure:
Soft start - this could reduce risk by allowing marine mammals time to move away from the turbine and could be done at a relatively low cost.

Cut in speed management - this could be used to reduce risk during periods of known higher activity in sensitive sites. 

It is still unclear whether these offer additional mitigation and to an extent a soft start happens naturally. Implementation of this measure could result in a loss of revenue for the developer.

Interaction: Potential barrier to movement due to the physical presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures, cables and electrical equipment.
Specific Management Measures: Array installation carried out in phases.
Implications of Measure: Allows close monitoring to observe any unexpected effects

Interaction: Reduced visibility impacting prey detection and obstruction avoidance.
Specific Management Measures: Modelling to predict the interaction between changes in sediment dynamics and animals.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for lighting to adversely affect nocturnal and migratory species.
Specific Management Measures: Consider type, color, and use of lighting during design and consultation  with navigational stakeholders.
Implications of Measure: A targeted lighting plan may have the potential to reduce impacts on sensitive species but navigational safety takes precedence.

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in device mooring lines and cables.
Specific Management Measures: Maintain taut mooring lines.
Implications of Measure: Would remove/reduce risk of entanglement, however mooring design driven by technical and commercial consideration. Entanglement records are a useful way to track events.

Interaction: Direct loss of protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed communities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings or support structures on the seabed.
Specific Management Measures: Minimise footprint of anchors/foundations.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce effects on sensitive habitats, however the size of anchors/foundations likely to be that which is suitable for the safe and optimal operation of devices.

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to removal or alteration of energy flow arising from devices and moorings or support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Modelling to predict the interaction between wave energy and animals.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in lost fishing gear or other equipment trapped on infrastructure.
Specific Management Measures: Ensure standard notifications of loss of fishing gear in region notified to operators. Reporting of entanglement events.
Implications of Measure: Good practice for emergency preparedness.

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Environmental monitoring to better understand near-field behaviour and avoidance.
Implications of Measure: This will help reduce scientific uncertainty, however monitoring can be costly.

Interaction: Potential for accidental or unplanned events which could lead to contamination of the marine environment.
Specific Management Measures:
Management: Establish and implement a Contamination Control Plan/Ship Oil Contamination Emergency Plans (SOPEPs).

Compliance with International Maritime Organization (IMO) and Maritime Coastguard Agency (MCA) codes for the prevention of contamination.
Implications of Measure: Reduces risk of any contamination event and ensures that contingency plans are in place. Demonstrates compliance with environmental management systems.

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Environmental monitoring to better understand near-field behaviour and avoidance.
Implications of Measure: This will help reduce scientific uncertainty, however this type of monitoring can be expensive and there are difficulties associated with storing and analysing the data produced.

Interaction: Sediment disturbance disrupting water clarity that results in smothering of fish spawning grounds.
Specific Management Measures: Best practice methodologies to reduce resuspension of sediment during cable burial or device foundation/mooring installation.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Modifications to tidal flows affect prey distribution and abundance resulting in changes to foraging behavior.
Specific Management Measures: Observational surveys (including remote sensing) of species (prey availability linked to benthic community).
Implications of Measure: Reduces scientific uncertainty.

Interaction: Potential for light from installation vessels to adversely affect nocturnal and migratory species.
Specific Management Measures: Monitoring effects on animals.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in device mooring lines and cables.
Specific Management Measures: Cable design with maximum bend radius.
Implications of Measure: Would remove/reduce risk of entanglement, however cable design driven by technical and commercial consideration. Entanglement records are a useful way to track events.

Interaction: Direct loss of protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed communities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings or support structures on the seabed.
Specific Management Measures: Cable protection management measures to ensure that any rock placement that is required will be kept to a minimum to reduce seabed disturbance.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce effects on sensitive habitats.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from subsea cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Install cable protection, armor, rock placement, or other cable protection.
Implications of Measure:
Reduces the level of EMF to surrounding water column and therefore any potential effects. 

Reduces 'snagging risk' for vessels and may create habitat for species.

May have Habitat Creation implications

Potential for adverse impacts on surrounding benthic habitats and sensitive species, e.g. from smothering.

This measure forms part of normal project design.

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in device mooring lines and cables.
Specific Management Measures: Routine inspections of mooring lines. Implement features into existing control systems to detect entanglement events.
Implications of Measure: Would remove/reduce risk of entanglement and is a low cost monitoring capability.

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Selective structural and blade coatings (e.g., colors to aide detection).
Implications of Measure: Unknown - it is possible that this will aid detection of subsea structures and help reduce risk. It can be captured in early project design for a small one-off cost, however further research is needed as there is potential for an increased collision risk through 'attraction'.

Interaction: Potential displacement of essential activities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings/support  structures.
Specific Management Measures: Site selection (taking into account cumulative impact of other developments).
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Selective structural and blade coatings (e.g., colors to aide detection).
Implications of Measure:
Unknown - it is possible that this will aid detection of subsea structures and help reduce risk although further research is needed - certain colours may serve to attract fish and lead to an increase in collision risk. 

A small one off cost that can be easily planned for at the design stage.

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects (siltation changes or smothering) on protected or sensitive littoral habitat due to devices and associated moorings, support structures, or landfall cables.
Specific Management Measures: Periodic visual monitoring through the use of divers, drop down video, or  intertidal shore surveys.
Implications of Measure: Generation of data to quantify level and spatial extent of effect.

Interaction: Potential barrier to movement due to the physical presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures, cables and electrical equipment.
Specific Management Measures: Array/ mooring configuration designed to avoid migratory routes or other important sites.

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to removal or alteration of energy flow arising from devices and moorings or support structures.

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Establish and implement a Biofouling Management Plan.

Interaction: Direct loss of protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed communities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings or support structures on the seabed.
Specific Management Measures: Use of locally sourced materials, for cable protection, of the same type as the habitat to be disturbed by cable installation.
Implications of Measure: Minimize impact on biodiversity/ ecosystem.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from landfall cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Install cable protection or armour.

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in lost fishing gear or other equipment trapped on infrastructure.

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to removal or alteration of energy flow arising from devices and moorings or support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Modelling to predict the interaction between changes in tidal flow, flux and turbulence structure and animals.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: The potential effects from underwater noise generated by wave and tidal energy converters.
Specific Management Measures: Measure noise generated by device(s) during operation to better understand the potential effects on sensitive species.
Implications of Measure: Measured noise levels can be correlated with threshold values of relevant species to determine impact and need for adaptive management measures, however this can be complex  and costly to undertake this type of monitoring in high energy environments.

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Install a 'detect and shut-down' system using active sonar and other appropriate monitoring equipment.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce/remove risk of collision with moving blades and enable a route through the consenting process, particulalrly at high sensitivity locations. However, this could affect power production, is expensive to implement and does not help to reduce scientific uncertainty regarding the risk. The reductions in power production, although small, would bring about uncertainty in the investment process and there are questions around impacts of sonar on sensitive species.

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Antifouling application on components such as the pile and rodos blades.
Implications of Measure: To prevent colonisation of the device and prevent the structure forming a stepping stone for non-native species.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from landfall cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Micrositing of offshore infrastructure to avoid sensitive habitats and minimise footprint.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce/remove effects on sensitive habitats and can often be done with little additional cost.

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in lost fishing gear or other equipment trapped on infrastructure.
Specific Management Measures: Fisheries management: Agreement with fishermen not to fish near to the device, warning of the dangers of losing equipment.
Implications of Measure: Reduces potential for entanglement of fishing gear in mooring lines and thus potential for entanglement of sea turtles.

Interaction: Potential barrier to movement due to the physical presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures, cables and electrical equipment.
Specific Management Measures: Array/mooring configuration designed to avoid migratory routes or other important sites.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: The potential effects from underwater noise generated during installation/ construction (excluding piling).
Specific Management Measures: Limit vessel speed.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: The potential effects from airborne noise generated during installation/construction (excluding piling).
Specific Management Measures: Avoid/limit 'noisy works' within close proximity to sensitive sites (e.g., known seal haul outs and important cliff nesting sites) during sensitive periods, defining appropriate clearance distances where necessary.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce potential effects on sensitive species during sensitive periods, however may could increase project construction timescales e.g. if continuous drilling time is restricted or specific periods need to be avoided.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from landfall cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Maximise length of any drilled boreholes.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for light from installation vessels to adversely affect nocturnal and migratory species.
Specific Management Measures: Limit lighting on installation vessels to that safe for navigational purposes only.
Implications of Measure: Reduce impact on sensitive species. A lot of the light on navigational vessels is superflous so would not detract from their safe operation.

Interaction: Potential for accidental or unplanned events which could lead to contamination of the marine environment.
Specific Management Measures:
Management: Establish and implement a Contamination Control Plan / Ship Oil Contamination Emergency Plans (SOPEPs).

Compliance with International Maritime Organization (IMO) and Maritime Coastguard Agency (MCA) codes for the prevention of contamination.
Implications of Measure: Reduces risk of any contamination event, ensures that contingency plans are in place and demonstrates compliance with environmental management systems.

Interaction: Potential for accidental or unplanned events which could lead to contamination of the marine environment.
Specific Management Measures:
Management: Establish and implement a Contamination Control Plan/Ship Oil Contamination Emergency Plans (SOPEPs).
Compliance with International Maritime Organization (IMO) and Maritime Coastguard Agency (MCA) codes for the prevention of contamination.
Implications of Measure: Reduces risk of any contamination event and ensures that contingency plans are in place. Demonstrates compliance with environmental management systems.

Interaction: Potential for accidental or unplanned events which could lead to contamination of the marine environment.
Specific Management Measures: Physical containment systems including bulk heads, closed circuit systems, pressure relief systems.
Implications of Measure: Reduces risk of contamination escaping from structure.

Interaction: The introduction of infrastructure and artificial substrates will provide habitat and artificial refuges.
Specific Management Measures: Monitor near-field behaviours.
Implications of Measure: Informs understanding of potential positive impacts from colonisation and use of the project infrastructure which could benefit future project applications. However, there is a cost implication associated with monitoring.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from landfall cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Strategic use of rock placement/other cable protection.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for oil spill incident resulting from the influence of unfavourable weather conditions.
Specific Management Measures: Vessel activities to occur in suitable weather conditions.
Implications of Measure: Reduces the chance for oil spill to the environment

Interaction: Potential risk of entrapment within device chambers and mooring arrays.
Specific Management Measures: Release entrapped animal.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for accidental or unplanned events which could lead to contamination of the marine environment.
Specific Management Measures: Material selection - lubricants, coolants, hydraulic fluids etc. selected with low ecotoxicity levels and biodegradable.
Implications of Measure: Reduces/removes risk of contamination from materials which may have escaped structure. However, the use of lower toxicity materials may compromise performance, or impact other technical issue (e.g. fluuid changes).

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects (siltation changes or smothering) on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to scour or siltation around devices and associated moorings, support structures and export cables.
Specific Management Measures: Periodic visual monitoring through the use of divers or drop down video, static cameras / remote sensing techniques,  benthic grab surveys,  geophysical survey to identify scour pits, turbidity measurements.
Implications of Measure:
Implementation of this measure would generate data to quantify level and spatial extent of effect, however there are technical and health and safety risks associated with periodic monitoring in close vicinity of infrastructure. This measure may also require power shut down. 

Additionally, the associated subsea static monitoring options require O&M which has potential time and cost implications.

Interaction: Modifications to prey distribution and abundance (to include for other receptors) resulting in changes to foraging behavior.
Specific Management Measures: Design structures to minimize effect on turbulence structure.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for collision with project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Adhere to minimum approach distances for vessels on approach.
Implications of Measure: Reduces potential effects and is a relatively low cost measure.

Interaction: Direct loss of protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed communities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings or support structures on the seabed.
Specific Management Measures: Micrositing of offshore infrastructure to avoid sensitive habitats and minimise footprint.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce/remove effects on sensitive habitats and is a relatively low cost measure.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from landfall cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Bundle cables together to reduce field vectors.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Compliance with all relevant guidance (including IMO guidelines) regarding ballast water management and transfer of non-native species.
Implications of Measure: Would remove/reduce risk of transfer and settlement of non-native species.

Interaction: Potential displacement of essential activities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures.
Specific Management Measures: None identified.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects (siltation changes or smothering) on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to scour or siltation around devices and associated moorings, support structures and export cables.
Specific Management Measures: Micrositing of export cables and infrastructure to minimise the impact on sensitive habitats and species. Best practice techniques for cable installation, burial, and protection.
Implications of Measure: Reduces, limits or offsets potential impacts on sensitive habitats and species.

Interaction: Modifications to prey distribution and abundance (to include for other receptors) resulting in changes to foraging behavior.
Specific Management Measures: Modelling to predict the interaction between changes in tidal flow, flux, and turbulence structure and animals.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Direct loss of protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed communities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings or support structures on the seabed.
Specific Management Measures: Minimise footprint of anchors/foundations.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce effects on sensitive habitats, however may impact technical considerations.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from landfall cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Bury cables where possible and viable.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Accidental release of contaminants during installation including diesel fuel, oil hydraulic fluids, etc.
Specific Management Measures: Best practice methodologies to reduce risk of accidental release of contaminants.
Implications of Measure: Reduces risk of contamination escaping from structure.

Interaction: Reduced visibility from altered water clarity associated with sediment mixing that can impact prey detection and obstruction avoidance.
Specific Management Measures: Best practice methodologies to reduce resuspension of sediment during cable burial or device foundation/mooring installation.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential barrier to movement due to the physical presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures, cables and electrical equipment.
Specific Management Measures: Monitoring of existing developments.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential displacement of essential activities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures.
Specific Management Measures: NA
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Disturbance at seal haul-out sites from project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Avoid transiting within 500m of known seal haul outs.
Implications of Measure: Reduces potential effects and is a relatively low cost measure.

Interaction: Potential displacement of essential activities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Employ an MMO during periods when noisy operations are likely to cause disturbance (e.g, all operations using a DP vessel).
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Establish and implement a Biofouling Management Plan.
Implications of Measure: Reduces/removes risk of transfer and settlement of non-native species.

Interaction: Potential displacement of essential activities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Array/ mooring configuration designed to avoid migratory routes or other important sites.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects (siltation changes or smothering) on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to scour or siltation around devices and associated moorings, support structures, and export cables.
Specific Management Measures: Minimize the amount of structure on the seabed.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Environmental monitoring to better understand near-field behaviour and avoidance.
Implications of Measure: Would reduce scientific uncertainty around the issue, however can be costly to implement.

Interaction: Potential for disturbance from project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Care will be taken to avoid splitting up groups and mothers and young.
Implications of Measure: Reduces potential effects and is a relatively low cost measure.

Interaction: The introduction of infrastructure and artificial substrates will provide habitat and artificial refuges.
Specific Management Measures: Monitor near-field behaviours.
Implications of Measure: Informs understanding of potential positive impacts from colonization and use of the project infrastructure which could benefit future project applications, however there is a cost implication associated with monitoring.

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Avoid the introduction of hard bottom substrate into a soft bottom habitat.
Implications of Measure:
Ensures the efficient recovery of species native to the surrounding habitat. 

May have technical implications.

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Adhere to appropriate measures when jettisoning ballast water.
Implications of Measure: Reduces/removes risk of transfer and settlement of non-native species.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from subsea cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Install cable protection, armor, rock placement, or other cable protection.
Implications of Measure:
Reduces the level of EMF to surrounding water column and therefore any potential effects. 

Reduces 'snagging risk' for vessels and may create habitat for species.

Potential for adverse impacts on surrounding benthic habitats and sensitive species, e.g. from smothering.

This measure forms part of normal project design.

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects (siltation changes or smothering) on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to scour or siltation around devices and associated moorings, support structures and export cables.
Specific Management Measures: Modelling to predict the interaction between changes in sediment dynamics and animals.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Selective structural and blade coatings (e.g., colors to aide detection.
Implications of Measure: Unknown - it is possible that this will aid detection of subsea structures and help reduce risk at a low cost. Lack of understanding and further research needed, it may be that certain colours could result in attraction resulting in an increase in collision risk.

Interaction: Potential for disturbance from project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Vessel speed limitation to and from site.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for lighting to adversely affect nocturnal and migratory species.
Specific Management Measures: Consider type, colour and use of lighting during design and consultation  with navigational stakeholders.
Implications of Measure: A targeted lighting plan may have the potential to reduce impacts on sensitive species but navigational safety takes precedence.

Interaction: Modifications to prey distribution and abundance (to include for other receptors) resulting in changes to foraging behaviour.
Specific Management Measures: Observational surveys (including remote sensing) of bird and marine mammals (prey availability linked to benthic community).
Implications of Measure: Would result in a reduction of scientific uncertainty around the interaction, however determining impacts against natural variability may be difficult and monitoring expensive.

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Source vessels locally.
Implications of Measure: Reduces/removes risk of transfer and settlement of non-native species.

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to removal or alteration of energy flow arising from devices and moorings or support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Pre and post installation monitoring of sensitive benthic communities, based on diver, drop down, static visual surveys (camera), or grab sampling.
Implications of Measure: Would result in a reduction of scientific uncertainty, however interpretation of data for statistical purposes may not have power to detect change generated by impact. In addition it may  require correlation with detailed Computational Fluid Dynamics studies and physical flow measurements.

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Implement a 'soft start' approach during cut-in.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for disturbance from project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Employ an MMO during periods when noisy operations are likely to cause disturbance (e.g., all operations using a DP vessel).
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects on protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed due to removal or alteration of energy flow arising from devices and moorings or support structures.
Specific Management Measures: Installation of ADCPs and turbulence sensors to better understand the baseline tidal flow conditions and hence the change in tidal flow due to presence of the device(s)
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Direct loss of protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed communities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings or support structures on the seabed.
Specific Management Measures: Minimize footprint of anchors / foundations.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce effects on sensitive habitats, however the size of anchors/foundations likely to be that which is suitable for the safe and optimal operation of devices.

Interaction: The potential effects from underwater noise generated during installation/ construction (excluding piling).
Specific Management Measures: Avoid/limit 'noisy works' within close proximity to sensitive sites (e.g., known seal haul outs during sensitive periods) defining appropriate clearance distances where necessary.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce potential effects on sensitive species during sensitive periods, but could increase project construction timescales and thus costs e.g. if continuous drilling time is restricted or specific periods need to be avoided.

Interaction: Pontential risk of collision with device giving size and character of structure
Specific Management Measures: Device components (e.g., transformer and power conditioning equipment) are designed internally.
Implications of Measure: Reduces potential for collision with external moving parts

Interaction: Potential for disturbance from project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Limit use of vessels, e.g. one vessel present with regular use of thrusters to maintain position.
Implications of Measure: Reduces potential disturbance effects

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Establish and implement a Biofouling Management Plan.
Implications of Measure: Reduce/removes risk of transfer of non-native species.

Interaction: Potential for disturbance from project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Do not break up or 'flush' rafts of birds.
Implications of Measure:
Reduces potential effects and is a relatively low cost measure, however effectiveness of mitigation is unclear. 

Also pertinent to note that the measure is selectively applied to project vessels in context of other vessel operations.

Interaction: Potential barrier to movement due to the physical presence of devices and associated moorings/support structures, cables and electrical equipment.
Specific Management Measures: Array instalation carried out in phases.
Implications of Measure: Allows close monitoring to observe any unexpected effects

Interaction: Potential for disturbance from project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Avoid sudden changes of speed.
Implications of Measure: Reduces likelihood of any further disturbance to cetaceans in the vicinity

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Adhere to appropriate measures when jettisoning ballast water.
Implications of Measure: Reduce/removes risk of transfer of non-native species.

Interaction: Modifications to prey distribution and abundance (to include for other receptors) resulting in changes to foraging behaviour.
Specific Management Measures: Design structures to minimise effect on turbulence structure.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Direct loss of protected or sensitive sub-littoral seabed communities due to the presence of devices and associated moorings or support structures on the seabed.
Specific Management Measures: Use of locally sourced materials, for cable protection, of the same type as the habitat to be disturbed by cable installation.
Implications of Measure: Minimize impact on biodiversity/ecosystem.

Interaction: Potential for disturbance from project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Adhere to minimum approach distances for vessels on approach.
Implications of Measure:
Reduces potential effects and is a relatively low cost measure, however effectiveness of mitigation is unclear. Can increase the time of operational procedures and thus increase cost.

Further monitoring, e.g. defining of approach distances and then comparing these to see which are most effective would validate the efficacy of the measure.

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in device mooring lines and cables.
Specific Management Measures: Maintain taut mooring lines.
Implications of Measure: Removes/reduces risk of entanglement, however mooring design tends to be driven by technical and commercial consideration. An entanglement record is a useful way to track events.

Interaction: The potential wider or secondary effects (siltation changes or smothering) on protected or sensitive littoral habitat due to devices and associated moorings, support structures or landfall cables.
Specific Management Measures: Benthic and intertidal surveys focused on indicator species, species assemblage, community structure and ecosystem function.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Source vessels locally.
Implications of Measure: Reduce/removes risk of transfer of non-native species.

Interaction: Potential for disturbance from project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Avoidance of sensitive shore nesting areas during sensitive periods with appropriate clearance distance.
Implications of Measure: Reduces potential effects and is a relatively low cost measure.

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in device mooring lines and cables.
Specific Management Measures: Cable design with maximum bend radius.
Implications of Measure: Removes/reduces risk of entanglement, however cable design tends to be driven by technical and commercial consideration.

Interaction: Modifications to prey distribution and abundance (to include for other receptors) resulting in changes to foraging behaviour.
Specific Management Measures: Modelling to predict the interaction between changes in tidal flow, flux and turbulence structure and animals.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction:
Seabed habitat disturbance/loss or changes to
seabed habitat
Specific Management Measures: Adherence to vessel anchor and device anchor/mooring plans.
Implications of Measure: Minimize impact on biodiversity/ ecosystem.

Interaction: Potential for disturbance from project vessels.
Specific Management Measures: Vessel transit route: defining routes to avoid sensitive sites and to only disturb one route.
Implications of Measure: Reduces potential effects and is a relatively low cost measure.

Interaction: Potential for marine animals to become entangled in device mooring lines and cables.
Specific Management Measures: Install tension sensors on mooring lines.
Implications of Measure: Informs of problem with mooring lines allowing rectification, however this comes at an additional cost and control system integration requirement.

Interaction: Potential for introduction of MNNS which can have an adverse impact on the native species at the site.
Specific Management Measures: Antifouling application on components such as the pile and rodos blades.
Implications of Measure: To prevent colonization of the device and prevent the structure forming a stepping stone for non-native species.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from landfall cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Device components (e.g., transformer and power conditioning equipment) are designed internally.
Implications of Measure: Reduces field effects external to the device

Interaction: Potential for accidental or unplanned events which could lead to contamination of the marine environment.
Specific Management Measures: Material selection - lubricants, coolants, hydraulic fluids etc. selected with low ecotoxicity levels and biodegradable.
Implications of Measure: Reduces/removes risk of contamination from materials which may have escaped structure. However, use of lower toxicity may compromise performance, or impact other technical issues (e.g. fluid changes).

Interaction: The potential effects from underwater noise generated during installation/ construction (excluding piling).
Specific Management Measures: Avoid/limit 'noisy works' within close proximity to sensitive sites i.e. known seal haul outs during sensitive periods, defining appropriate clearance distances where necessary.
Implications of Measure: This could reduce potential effects on sensitive species during sensitive periods, but could increase project construction timescales and thus costs e.g. if continuous drilling time is restricted or specific periods need to be avoided.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from subsea cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Use of 3-phase cables instead of DC cables.
Implications of Measure:
Reduce the level of EMF to surrounding water column and therefore any potential effects.

Potential commercial and technical feasibility issues some disagreement as to efficacy of this measure. Additionally, the cables used will largely depend upon the project requirements.

Interaction: The potential effects from underwater noise generated by wave and tidal energy converters.
Specific Management Measures: Measure noise generated by device(s) during operation to better understand the potential effects on sensitive species.
Implications of Measure:
Measured noise levels can be correlated with threshold values of relevant species to determine impact and need for adaptive management measures. 

It can be complex and costly to undertake this type of monitoring in high energy environments.

Interaction: Impacts of electromagnetic fields from subsea cables on sensitive species.
Specific Management Measures: Use of 3-phase cables instead of DC cables.
Implications of Measure:
Reduce the level of EMF to surrounding water column and therefore any potential effects.

Potential commercial and technical feasibility issues some disagreement as to efficacy of this measure.

Interaction: Modifications to prey distribution and abundance (to include for other receptors) resulting in changes to foraging behaviour.
Specific Management Measures: Site selection.
Implications of Measure: NA

Interaction: The introduction of infrastructure and artificial substrates will provide habitat and artificial refuges.
Specific Management Measures: Monitor near-field behaviours.
Implications of Measure: Informs understanding of potential for colonisation, however there is a cost implication associated with monitoring.

Interaction: Potential for collision with turbine blades.
Specific Management Measures: Install a 'detect and shut-down' system using active sonar and other appropriate monitoring equipment (e.g., Marine Mammal Detections Sonar System [MMDS]).
Implications of Measure: This could reduce/remove risk of collision with moving blades and enable a route through the consenting process, particulalrly at high sensitivity locations. However, this could affect power production, is expensive to implement and does not help to reduce scientific uncertainty regarding the risk. The reductions in power production, although small, would bring about uncertainty in the investment process and there are questions around impacts of sonar on sensitive species.
